office:text.text:h: Selecting a Caption Selects the Image

text:p.text:span: This document is provided to give

office:text.text:p: The combo of report#1 + report#2 (below) were made at BugZilla#164295 on Dec 12 2024. The bug was first documented at GitHub Python3Docs Bug#2. After a fortnight there were 3 significant responses to the BugZilla report:

text:p.text:span: The latest 25.2.0.0.beta1+ version is still affected by this bugVersion 6.1.0.0.alpha0+ is

text:list-item.text:p: It was introduced at version 6.5 on Fri Dec 6 14:04:55 2019 +0100

text:p.text:span: now understand that the reason that LibreOffice has been riddled with bugs for the last 5 years is
There now follow the original + updated bug reports
Selecting the whole of an image caption
(eg for rename) also selects the image. If the caption is then deleted the image itself will also be deleted.
will also select the image + caption above it. Deleting the text
paragraph will then delete both the paragraph + image + caption.

frame (here 0.5 cm) is added above the paragraph text rather than between the two borders

paragraphs, which have an inline border

office:text.text:p: Refer to the final pages for a practical demonstration of this set of bugs.

text:p.text:span: ibreOffice 3.3.0.4 & later all contain bug problem#4.
A set of old AppImages that include that version are available from
for brief help on installing an AppImage.

office:text.text:p: To easily demonstrate problem#1 (see page#7, #9 or #10):

text:p.text:span: key(cursor should show at front of ‘Figure’)

text:list-item.text:p: Under LO v7 & later image + caption are now both selected(s/b just the caption)

office:text.text:p: To easily demonstrate problem#2 (see page#9 or #10):

text:list-item.text:p: Do the same as (i) above, but this time start with the 1st letter of the 1st line on the paragraph that is below the Image.
Select to the end of the 1st line(no problem)

Select to the end of the whole paragraph(Under LO v7 & later the whole of the image above + caption + paragraph below has been selected)(that’s greedy; deleting the paragraph will now delete everything)

text:p.text:span: This only happens on pages below that contain both an image + text below the image.
Place your cursor to the left of the 1
Enter the command to insert a new page(this is either
Note that the Page Break has been inserted
Trying the same command on a page that has more than one Pilcrow, after the 1
ake a visual inspection of the final page
is set at 0.5 cm) is placed above the 1

text:list-item.text:p: The text top-border correct location should be between the bottom of the frame & the top of the text border. However, the text has been captured by the image+caption, and the border has been placed above the frame. I believe that this may be a frame error, rather than an image error.

text:p.text:span: a schematic layout of the encapsulations of the
schema for all pages is also within
extract files contained within this ODT + other archive files.
and it frames the whole of the image + caption

office:text.text:p: frame#1 contains a text-box (tb), and the text‑box contains yet another paragraph (p2) and that latter contains everything else on the page.
[The schema layout above became so complicated that I was forced to remove most of the colour highlighting (it was making it muddier, not clearer)]
This is how the encapsulations each end up:

text:p.text:span: is very simple (a single picture + it’s caption) but that becomes a little complicated as we try to understand the setup details. Those details
become important as we try to analyse the reason for the bugs in later pages.
The second example page is equally as simple as the first: 4 lines of text. The only wrinkle is that the 1
paragraph, whereas the last 3 lines are
paragraphs & thus have an embedded blue hairline border &
font. Apart from that they are perfectly normal
The final two pages are just a little bit more complicated, in that the text from the previous page is added to the bottom of the same image copied from
and the schematic hints at that fact:
he issue here is that the opening
has disappeared entirely. Because of that, I’ve labelled the closing paragraph (which does not have an opening paragraph) as “
”. The final 4 text lines are identical to their source. But remember: according to

office:text.text:p: The only change between the previous example (page#9) & this one (page#10) is that the 1st text paragraph below the image+caption on page#9 has been deleted. That allows us to visually see the erroneous way that the image takes the top border of the Code Box 2 text which — remember — is actually supposed to be below the image, and places that border above the image. However, also remind yourself that coder Stahl has clearly stated that this is all “working as designed” (phew! thank goodness for that; to my ignorant mind it all looks as buggy as hell).

text:p.text:span: The schematic drawn from content.xml is below. If you compare it to the 3
example page you will notice that an extra level of hell has been introduced, in that not only has
been removed (that is what we asked for) but also that
has been removed (did not ask for that)
We have thus ended up with some kind of strange abortion. But do not worry!
